page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: Of the 600 responses to the questionnaire the following is a breakdown of the housing stock of the area. In the Framwellgate Moor and Newton Hall areas half of the housing stock is privately owned, semi-detached, three bedroomed with garages. One quarter of the stock is council owned, three bedroomed semis - recently refurbished. The remaining stock in Framwellgate Moor and Newton Hall is made up of a) inter-war semis, b) link detached, c) detached or d) bungalows built in the 1960's and 1970's. There are very few flats or old style cottages. In the centre of Framwellgate Moor and in Pity Me there is a small number of terraced houses. The vast bulk of property in the area is privately owned.
